summary: Laryngeal cancer is a type of cancer that develops in any part of the larynx (voice box). It is typically a squamous-cell carcinoma. The prognosis is affected by the location of the tumor, which is divided into three anatomical regions: the glottis, the supraglottis, and the subglottis. Laryngeal cancer can spread by direct extension, metastasis to regional cervical lymph nodes, or via the bloodstream. It is considered a rare disease.
causes: Infections by some forms of HPV
risk_factors: History of head and neck cancer
symptoms: Feeling that something is stuck in the throat
diagnosis: Palpation of the neck and supraclavicular fossa
Examination of the oral cavity and oropharynx
Endoscopic examination of the larynx, trachea, and esophagus
treatments: Surgery (partial or full removal of the tumor)
